request_process.legal_authority: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act - RIGL Chapter 38-2
request_process.who_can_request: Every person or entity (no residency requirement)
request_process.how_to_request: Written request preferred but not required on specific form; must be readily identifiable as records request

agency_response_time.extension: Additional 20 business days if voluminous/complex request with written explanation

fees.search_time: $15 per hour after first hour (lowest paid employee capable rate)

request_process.appeals_process: Complaint to Attorney General; Superior Court mandamus action available with civil fines up to $1,000 per violation

key_exemptions: Personnel and medical files (clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy)
Preliminary drafts, notes, or inter/intra-agency memoranda not retained in ordinary course
Records specifically exempted from disclosure by statute
Trade secrets and commercial or financial information
Communications of advisory nature covering other than purely factual materials
Library records required by law to be confidential
Information that would jeopardize safety of personnel or public
Law enforcement investigatory records under certain circumstances
notable_features: Rhode Island was 49th state to enact FOIA law (1979)
Strong presumption of access - all records presumed public unless exempted
No statement of purpose required for records requests
Must provide reasonably segregable portions of partially exempt records
Attorney General investigates public records complaints
Superior Court jurisdiction statewide regardless of agency location
Civil fines up to $1,000 per violation for arbitrary or capricious denials
Each agency must adopt written procedures and post on website
